content.description: Climb the left side of the bulge on good jugs.
content.location: Upper Forestland area. Walk past "Lovage" and under "The Physical" to the outcrop on the left of the trail where you'll see the overhanging boulder home to "Sunny and Steep" and "Funny and Cheap".

content.description:
Funny and Cheap is the line to the right of the classic Sunny and Steep.  It uses the same sit start but moves right through some underclings to a couple of dynamic deadpoints before a mellow topout.

Not a bad problem by most standards, but it can be awkward for some.
content.location: Sunny and Steep boulder, Upper Forestlands

content.description: Climb the left arete of the boulder directly across from sunny and steep. Start down in the slot matched on the nice sidepull with feet on the obvious shelf. Slap the arete then hit the sharp mini jug high at center to set up for the top out. The move to the high friction mini jug is fun and the top out is friendly. Take care setting up the landing. There may well be a previous first assent of this some time ago but it was extremely lichen covered when it was cleaned.
content.protection: Probably two crash pads to fill hole beneath the start.
content.location: On the left edge of the boulder directly across from sunny and steep / funny and cheap. Down in the hole...

content.description: Start on the shelf about head level hand and heel matched. Throw out right to the rail, follow it up and right until it ends, toss to a jug and top out.
content.location: In Forestland Boulders sharing a boulder and just left of Sunny and Steep.
